weekly_top_story.headline: CMS Launches ACCESS Model to Expand Technology-Supported Chronic Care for Medicare Beneficiaries
weekly_top_story.summary: The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) launched the Advancing Chronic Care with Effective, Scalable Solutions (ACCESS) Model, a 10-year voluntary initiative starting July 2026 to test outcome-aligned payment approaches enabling clinicians to better manage common chronic conditions using technology, signaling a major shift toward modernizing Medicare chronic care.

stories.headline: House Passes Hospital Inpatient Services Modernization Act to Extend Acute Hospital Care at Home Program
stories.summary: The House of Representatives passed HR 4313, extending the Acute Hospital Care at Home program for five years, which promises to support hospital-at-home services and could transform care delivery models pending Senate approval.

stories.headline: Trump Administration Announces Major Savings from Second Year of Medicare Drug Price Negotiations
stories.summary: Federal savings from Medicare drug price negotiations are expected to reach $8.5 to $12 billion in 2027 due to steep price cuts on 15 high-cost drugs including Pfizer’s Ibrance and Novo Nordisk’s diabetes and weight loss medications.
